abstract: Methods you can implement to receive captured video frame images and tracking state from an AR session.
overview:
## Overview

Implement this protocol if you need to work directly with [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFrame] objects captured by the session or directly follow changes to the session’s set of tracked [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARAnchor] objects. Typically, you adopt this protocol when building a custom view for displaying AR content—if you display content with SceneKit or SpriteKit, the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSCNViewDelegate] and [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSKViewDelegate] protocols provide similar information and integrate with those technologies.

This protocol extends the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSessionObserver] protocol, so your session delegate can also implement those methods to respond to changes in session status.

# ARSessionDelegate

**Protocol**

Methods you can implement to receive captured video frame images and tracking state from an AR session.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol ARSessionDelegate : ARSessionObserver
```

## Overview

Implement this protocol if you need to work directly with [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFrame] objects captured by the session or directly follow changes to the session’s set of tracked [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARAnchor] objects. Typically, you adopt this protocol when building a custom view for displaying AR content—if you display content with SceneKit or SpriteKit, the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSCNViewDelegate] and [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSKViewDelegate] protocols provide similar information and integrate with those technologies.

This protocol extends the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSessionObserver] protocol, so your session delegate can also implement those methods to respond to changes in session status.

## Receiving Camera Frames

- **session(_:didUpdate:)**: Provides a newly captured camera image and accompanying AR information to the delegate.

## Handling Content Updates

- **session(_:didAdd:)**: Tells the delegate that one or more anchors have been added to the session.
- **session(_:didUpdate:)**: Tells the delegate that the session has adjusted the properties of one or more anchors.
- **session(_:didRemove:)**: Tells the delegate that one or more anchors have been removed from the session.

## Responding to events

- **delegate**: An object you provide to receive captured video images and tracking information, or to respond to changes in session status.
- **delegateQueue**: The dispatch queue through which the session calls your delegate methods.
- **ARSessionObserver**: Methods you can implement to respond to changes in the state of an AR session.

## Inherits From

- ARSessionObserver
- NSObjectProtocol
